title: detective1.1
body: Oh good, you're finally awake. I've been calling [[Answer:Player2.1|Player2.1]] [[Answer:Player2.2|Player2.2]]

title: Player2.1
body: What do you mean finally, it's 8:30 in the morning.[[Answer:Player2.2|Player2.1a]]

title: Player2.2
body: Yeah, I don't have a phone anymore [[Answer:Player2.2a|Player2.2a]]

title: Player2.1a
body: Normal people are never awake this early [[Answer:Detective3.1|Detective3.1]]

title: Player2.2a
body: Phones require money, money requires cases [[Answer:Detective3.2|Detective3.2]]

title: Detective3.1
body: Normal people don't look at dead bodies for a living [[Answer:Player4.1|Player4.1]] [[Answer:Player4.2|Player4.2]]

title: Detective3.2
body: Well then have I come with good news. I got a case. An interesting one too [[Answer:Player6.2|Player6.2]]

title: Player4.1
body: Normal people are also polite to their colleagues [[Answer:Detective5.1|Detective5.2]]

title: Player4.2
body: Ooh, so the case is a murder? Those pay well [[Answer:Detective5.1|Detective5.1]]

title: Detective5.2
body: I'm sure you'll forgive me after the bone I'm about to throw you. We got a murder case. Bad one. Chief wants you on it [[Answer:Player6.2|Player6.2]]

title: Detective5.1
body: Christ, you could at least pretend to care about the vic [[Answer:Player6.1|Player6.1]]

title: Player6.2
body: I could sure do with a case right now. Beyond sitting in my beat up sedan for hours on end, waiting for a spouse to sneak off with the pool boy [[Answer:Detective7.1|Detective7.1]]

title: Player6.1
body: *[i]shrugs[/i]* I have bills to pay. And if I eat any more ramen, I might just cut out my own tongue so I can never taste again [[Answer:Detective7.1|Detective7.1]]

title: Detective7.2
body: A jogger called in a body this morning, she found it in the alleyway next to the Rats, Bats, and Vats. John Doe [[Answer:Node|Player8.1]]

title: Player8.1
body: John? Oh no, poor Jane. She'll be heartbroken [[Answer:Detective9.1|Detective9.1]]

title: Detective9.1
body: Yes, but not as heartbroken as she'll be if we can't find the killer. C'mon. I'll drive you over
